introduction.01: üì∏ Welcome to my photography space! I've prepared two collections for now: the stunning mountain city of Chongqing and a showcase of travel pictures from across Europe.
introduction.02: I'm excited to share more soon, but take a look at these for now! I've been avidly taking pictures since 2022... <more>Read more</more>

body.01: I love capturing people and how they interact with their surroundings. What's a place without its people, after all? üì∏
body.02: I enjoy 'messy' shots or 'dirtying the frame' as professionals call it. Shots that tell a whole story in a single frame are my favorite.
body.03: I've been very picky about this‚Äîtoo picky, actually. I'm working on just taking more shots, trying different things. You never know which ones might inspire you later! ‚ú®
body.04: My main cameras are the Sony A7IV and the iPhone 15 Pro Max. üì∑üì±
body.05: I have two lenses: an 85mm telephoto and a 20mm wide-angle lens. I've mostly used the 85mm-love the depth of field, but lately, I've realized some of my favorite shots are with the 20mm.
body.06: I edit all my photos in Lightroom and finish in Photoshop, adding some blur and hallation. I focus on color and grading, keeping scenes as accurate as possible‚Äîno AI, and rarely any spot edits. üé®
body.07: I haven't added presets to my workflow yet, so editing a new batch of photos still takes quite some time.

intro.01: üëã Hey there! Welcome to my little space for all things web and engineering. üè°
intro.02: It's a work in progress, but I'm handling everything from content to design and implementation. üíª
intro.03: Curious about what, why, and how I do things? Dive into the threads below and keep reading! üëá

current.01: Right now, I'm focusing on the Photography space, turning it into my personal social media app. üì∑
current.02: For the engineering section, I want to keep it simple as a blog. üìù
current.03: But check back later - you might find this chat window turned into a fully functional one!
current.04: üîç Why I'm doing all of this?
current.05: I love creating things and doing them myself, especially if it can bring value to others. üåü
current.06: I'm fascinated by how different cultures approach technology, so stay tuned for more on that! üåç

background.01: I studied Media Informatics - a computer science major focused on project work. üéì
background.02: We did everything from requirements gathering to prototyping, designing, development, research, and analysis.
background.03: It was demanding, but I loved learning how to do it all.
background.04: My focus areas were multimedia, human-computer interaction, and engineering.
background.05: I particularly enjoy creating eye-catching, highly interactive and engaging user experiences that are fun to use.
background.06: For my thesis, I developed a game using eye-tracking and gesture controls. üéÆ
background.07: That was almost ten years ago, and now we have tech like Meta Quest and Apple Vision Pro!

professional.01: I've been a professional web software engineer since 2017. üíº
professional.02: I've gained experience developing high-performing, scalable solutions and most importantly, solutions that were easy to work with for me peers.
professional.03: The best times at work are when I'm involved in everything to implement impactful solutions.
professional.04: I've had great relationships with mentors and superiors, always picking their brains non-stop. üß†
professional.05: I've delved into every step needed to deploy features, microservices, and apps from small to international scale.
professional.06: From implementation, testing, automation, and QA to monitoring and analytics. üîÑ
professional.07: I've focused a lot on Frontend, Web Performance, tooling, SEO, CMS, and A/B testing.
professional.08: I'm also very interested in diving deeper into real-time systems, payments, AI, and user-related topics. All vital for creating more impactful and user-centric solutions. ü§ñ

tools.01: These days, most of my work is with JavaScript/TypeScript and NodeJS. üõ†Ô∏è
tools.02: I primarily use frameworks like React and NextJS to build dynamic, high-performance web applications.

outro.01: Alright, that's it for now! Hope this gives you a good overview.
outro.02: If you have exciting opportunities or challenges that resonate with my skill set and interests I'd love to hear from you. üì¨
